definition: Hunan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
abbr. for Hunan 湖南 province in south central China/abbr. for Xiangjiang river in Hunan province

sentences.english: Xiang Embroidery gained popularity day by day.
sentences.chinese: 湘繡贏得了聲望與日俱增。

sentences.english: Xiang embroidery has a long history and can be dated to the Spring and Autumn Warring States Period more than two thousands years ago.
sentences.chinese: 湘繡歷史悠久，可追溯到二千多年前的春秋戰國時期。

sentences.english: Xiang Embroidery is famous for its rich colors.
sentences.chinese: 湘繡以其華麗的顏色而聞名。

sentences.english: Xiang embroidery is famous with embroider tiger.
The most persuasive evidence of Xiang Embroidery is the articles unearthed in Mawangdui Han Tomb.
sentences.chinese: 在湘繡最有說服力的證據是第馬王堆漢墓中出土。

definition: Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
Jixi county in Xuancheng 宣城[Xuan1 cheng2], Anhui
paper dolls for ritual use in the shape of people or animals
the China Seas (the seas of the Western Pacific Ocean, around China: Bohai Sea, Yellow Sea, East China Sea, South China Sea)
to store/to have sth in storage
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
Xianyou county in Putian 莆田[Pu2 tian2], Fujian
Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, abbr. 寧|宁[Ning2], capital Yinchuan 銀川|银川[Ying2 chuan1]
pinyin: Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1
